French border police accused of causing shipwrecks and deaths of migrants from Comoros
subhead: Since 2010, several hundred Comorians have died at sea while trying to reach the French overseas territory of Mayotte. A joint investigation by Le Monde and the investigative media outlet Lighthouse Reports shows that police maneuvers are implicated in several of these shipwrecks.
byline: By Raphaëlle Aubert, Julia Pascual (Mayotte), Jack Sapoch (motion design, Lighthouse Reports), Tomas Statius (Mayotte, Lighthouse Reports) and Maud Jullien (Lighthouse Reports)

Nathalie Loiseau, MEP: 'After the assassination of Charlie Kirk, silence speaks louder than words'
subhead: What supporters of the American influencer were demanding in the European Parliament was not a minute of silence, but the silencing of those who disagree with them, writes Loiseau. She has received death threats for publicly opposing the tribute.

title: The Bayeux Tapestry, a barometer of Franco-British relations
subhead: France's decision to lend the nearly 1,000-year-old tapestry to the United Kingdom represents part of the long and tumultuous relationship between the two countries; Brexit supporters had even turned the tapestry into a symbol of national humiliation.

title: An abbey in southern France rescued by contemporary art
subhead: 'Strange places for an exhibition' (6/6). Le Monde explores six art centers set up in unusual locations. Today: a magnificent Cistercian abbey rescued from ruin by Geneviève Bonnefoi and Pierre Brache.

title: Francesca Albanese, a critical Western voice on Gaza
subhead: At a conference at a left-wing festival near Paris, the UN special rapporteur on the occupied Palestinian territories received a standing ovation after denouncing European governments' inaction over Israel's destruction of Gaza. Her stance has drawn accusations of antisemitism and activism from critics.
byline: By Allan Kaval (Rome (Italy), correspondent), Benjamin Barthe and Madjid Zerrouky

byline: By Véronique Chocron and Manon Romain

title: Charlie Kirk assassination: The suspect's disconcerting profile
subhead: Tyler Robinson, arrested on Thursday night, is a 22-year-old White man who grew up in a conservative family in Utah and was a brilliant high school student. Nothing in his background supports the theory being propagated in MAGA circles that he is a far-left activist.
byline: By Arnaud Leparmentier (Saint George, (Utah) special correspondent)

title: France's best art exhibitions this fall, in Paris and beyond
subhead: Here is Le Monde's selection of must-see art exhibitions, from painter John Singer Sargent to medieval forgeries to contemporary Nigerian artist Otobong Nkanga, which will go on display through the end of the year.
